title: 01. Getting started

title: 01. Getting started
text: package installed, can got File > New Project… RStudio, choose “Package Shiny App Using golem” input:  want directly via command line, use: command allows create “illegally-named” package (example, 1234) passing check_name argument FALSE. Note recommended done know . ’ve got , new RStudio project launched. structure project: ’re already familiar R packages, files seem familiar . ’s golem app package. DESCRIPTION & NAMESPACE: Package meta-data. R/app_config.R: Used read inside golem config file located inst/golem-config.yml. R/app_server.R, R/app_ui.R: Top level UI server elements. R/run_app.R: function configure launch application. dev/: Scripts used along process developing app. don’t need fill script starting: use notebook keeping track ’re along project life. inst/app/www: add external dependencies www (images, css, etc), notably added golem functions used create external resources. man: Package documentation, generated R & roxygen2.
code: golem::create_golem(path = "path/to/package") #> ├── DESCRIPTION  #> ├── NAMESPACE  #> ├── R  #> │   ├── app_config.R  #> │   ├── app_server.R  #> │   ├── app_ui.R  #> │   └── run_app.R  #> ├── dev  #> │   ├── 01_start.R  #> │   ├── 02_dev.R  #> │   ├── 03_deploy.R  #> │   └── run_dev.R  #> ├── inst  #> │   ├── app  #> │   │   └── www  #> │   │       └── favicon.ico  #> │   └── golem-config.yml  #> └── man  #>     └── run_app.Rd

title: 01. Getting started
text: First, fill DESCRIPTION adding information package contain app. first function, fill_desc(), can used fill DESCRIPTION file: DESCRIPTION file. Additionally, fill_desc() sets series recommended global options golem-config.yml reused inside golem.
code: golem::fill_desc(   pkg_name = "shinyexample", # The name of the golem package containing the app (typically lowercase, no underscore or periods)   pkg_title = "PKG_TITLE", # What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case, No Period)   pkg_description = "PKG_DESC.", # What the package does (one paragraph).   authors = person(     given = "AUTHOR_FIRST", # Your First Name     family = "AUTHOR_LAST", # Your Last Name     email = "AUTHOR@MAIL.COM", # Your email     role = c("aut", "cre"), # Your role (here author/creator)     set_options = TRUE # Set the global golem options   ),   repo_url = NULL, # The URL of the GitHub repo (optional),   pkg_version = "0.0.0.9000" # The version of the package containing the app )

title: 03. Deploy your app
text: launching app, might noticed dev/run_dev.R function calls run_app(), following structure: function might look little bit weird, ’s long story behind , can read . long story short, combination with_golem_options & golem_opts = list(...) allows pass arguments function used inside application, UI server side, can get get_golem_options(). idea provide flexibility deployment platform want run app .
code: run_app <- function(...) {   with_golem_options(     app = shinyApp(       ui = app_ui,       server = app_server     ),     golem_opts = list(...)   ) } run_app(this = "that") # And in the app this <- get_golem_options("this")

title: 05. Configuration
text: start new golem application, ’ll find file called golem-config.yml inst/ folder. default, file contains name app, version, default working directory (root package). config file based {config} format, allows create configuration files different application contexts. Please refer package documentation information.

title: 05. Configuration
text: default config file looks like: default/golem_name, default/golem_version, default/app_prod usable across whole life golem app: developing, also production. production/app_prod might used adding elements used app production. dev/golem_wd dev config moment might reliably use config developing app. Use app_sys() function want rely package path app deployed. good news don’t want/need use config, can safely ignore file, just leave : used internally golem functions. options globally set : functions reading options config file : can set :
code: default:   golem_name: golex   golem_version: 0.0.0.9000   app_prod: no  production:   app_prod: yes  dev:   golem_wd: !expr golem::pkg_path() set_golem_options() #> ── Setting {golem} options in `golem-config.yml` ─────────────────────────────── #> ✔ Setting `golem_name` to golex #> ✔ Setting `golem_wd` to golem::pkg_path() #> You can change golem working directory with set_golem_wd('path/to/wd') #> ✔ Setting `golem_version` to 0.0.0.9000 #> ✔ Setting `app_prod` to FALSE #> ── Setting {usethis} project as `golem_wd` ───────────────────────────────────── #> ✔ Setting active project to "/tmp/Rtmpy2mrFj/golex". default:   golem_name: golex   golem_version: 0.0.0.9000   app_prod: no production:   app_prod: yes dev:   golem_wd: !expr golem::pkg_path() get_golem_name() #> [1] "golex" get_golem_wd() #> [1] "/tmp/Rtmpy2mrFj/golex" get_golem_version() #> [1] "0.0.0.9000" set_golem_name("this") set_golem_wd(".") set_golem_version("0.0.1") default:   golem_name: golex   golem_version: 0.0.0.9000   app_prod: no production:   app_prod: yes dev:   golem_wd: !expr golem::pkg_path()

title: 06. Extending `{golem}`
text: example function can used remove dev/ folder: one create CSS:
code: no_dev <- function(path, package_name, ...) {   fs::dir_delete("dev") } create_golem("ici", project_hook = no_dev) new_css <- function(path, package_name, ...) {   css_path <- fs::path_abs("inst/app/www/custom.css")    fs::file_create(css_path)    write_there <- function(...) {     write(..., file = css_path, append = TRUE)   }    write_there("body {")   write_there("    background-color:red;")   write_there("}")    cli_cat_bullet("CSS generated") }  create_golem("ici", project_hook = new_css)

title: 06. Extending `{golem}`
text: maintenance mode turned whenever R process detects GOLEM_MAINTENANCE_ACTIVE environment variable set TRUE. visualize maintenance page locally, can run following: ’re deploying Posit Connect, can set variable setup panel. command line, can also
code: withr::with_envvar(   c("GOLEM_MAINTENANCE_ACTIVE" = TRUE),   {     golem::run_dev()   } ) Sys.setenv("GOLEM_MAINTENANCE_ACTIVE" = TRUE) golem::run_dev() export GOLEM_MAINTENANCE_ACTIVE=TRUE && Rscript -e "mygolem::run_app()"

title: 06. Extending `{golem}`
text: golem comes default maintenance page, can override use custom page. order use page, need pass either html_document tagList with_golem_options function run_app.R: :
code: run_app <- function(   onStart = NULL,   options = list(),   enableBookmarking = NULL,   uiPattern = "/",   ... ) {   with_golem_options(     app = shinyApp(       ui = app_ui,       server = app_server,       onStart = onStart,       options = options,       enableBookmarking = enableBookmarking,       uiPattern = uiPattern     ),     golem_opts = list(...),     maintenance_page = tagList(       fluidRow(         h1("Under maintenance"),         span("Coming soon...")       )     )   ) } run_app <- function(   onStart = NULL,   options = list(),   enableBookmarking = NULL,   uiPattern = "/",   ... ) {   with_golem_options(     app = shinyApp(       ui = app_ui,       server = app_server,       onStart = onStart,       options = options,       enableBookmarking = enableBookmarking,       uiPattern = uiPattern     ),     golem_opts = list(...),     maintenance_page = shiny::htmlTemplate(       filename = app_sys(         "custom_maintenance_page.html"       )     )   ) }

title: A Framework for Robust Shiny Applications
text: ’re reading doc version: 0.5.1.9005. Note golem follows semantic versioning scheme. Production-grade shiny applications, creation deployment. golem opinionated framework sets standard building production-grade shiny applications. provides structured environment enforces best practices, fosters maintainability, ensures applications reliable, ready deployment real-world environments. golem, developers can focus creating high-quality, robust shiny apps confidence, knowing framework guides every step development process.

Default get_golem_wd(). dir Path dir file created. open created file opened? dir_create Deprecated. removed future versions throws error now. with_doc_ready JS file - default file include $( document ).ready()? template Function writing created file. may overwrite template function. ... Arguments passed template function. initialize JS file - Whether add initialize method. Default FALSE. JavaScript API require initialize components using . dev Whether insert console.log calls important methods binding. help building input binding. Default FALSE. events List events generate event listeners subscribe method. instance, list(name = c("click", "keyup"), rate_policy = c(FALSE, TRUE)). list contain names rate policies apply event. rate policy found, debounce method default delay 250 ms applied. may edit manually according https://shiny.rstudio.com/articles/building-inputs.html

title: Create a Dockerfile for your App — add_dockerfile
text: path path DESCRIPTION file use input. output name Dockerfile output. pkg Path root package. Default get_golem_wd(). Dockerfile. Default   Dockerfile. Default NULL. port options('shiny.port') run App. Default 80. host options('shiny.host') run App. Default 0.0.0.0. sysreqs boolean. TRUE, RUN statements install packages system requirements included Dockerfile. repos character. URL(s) repositories use options("repos"). expand boolean. TRUE system requirement RUN line. open boolean. Dockerfile/README/README open creation? Default TRUE. update_tar_gz boolean. TRUE build_golem_from_source also TRUE, updated tar.gz created. build_golem_from_source boolean. TRUE tar.gz created Dockerfile directly mount source folder. extra_sysreqs character vector. Extra debian system requirements. source_folder path Package/golem source folder deploy. default retrieved via get_golem_wd(). lockfile path renv.lock file use. default NULL. output_dir folder export everything deployment related. distro One "focal", "bionic", "xenial", "centos7", "centos8". See available distributions https://hub.docker.com/r/rstudio/r-base/. document boolean. TRUE (default), DESCRIPTION file updated using attachment::att_amend_desc() creating renv.lock file dockerfile_cmd CMD add Dockerfile. NULL, default, CMD R -e "options('shiny.port'={port},shiny.host='{host}');library({appname});{appname}::run_app()\. user Name user specify Dockerfile USER instruction. Default rstudio, set NULL user image used. ... arguments pass renv::snapshot().
code: FROM rocker/verse  without renv.lock file passed `R.Version()$major`.`R.Version()$minor` is used as tag

Get the values   # 2.1 from the UI side    h1(get_golem_options("title"))    # 2.2 from the server-side    output$param <- renderPrint({     paste("param content = ", get_golem_options("content"))   })    output$param_full <- renderPrint({     get_golem_options() # list of all golem options as a list.   })    # 3. what: Interact with JavaScript built-in Functions — activate_js
title: Interact with JavaScript built-in Functions — activate_js
text: activate_js used insert directly JavaScript functions golem. default bundle_ressources() load function  automatically .

title: Interact with JavaScript built-in Functions — activate_js
code: activate_js()  invoke_js(fun, ..., session = shiny::getDefaultReactiveDomain())

title: Interact with JavaScript built-in Functions — activate_js
text: fun JS function invoked. ... JSON-like messages sent triggered JS function session shiny session within call sendCustomMessage. show Show element jQuery selector provided. Example: golem::invoke_js("show", "#id");. hide Hide element jQuery selector provided. Example: golem::invoke_js("hide", "#id"). showid Show element id provided. Example: golem::invoke_js("showid", "id"). hideid Hide element id provided. Example: golem::invoke_js("hideid", "id"). showclass showid, class. Example: golem::invoke_js("showclass", "someClass"). hideclass hideid, class. Example: golem::invoke_js("hideclass", "someClass"). showhref showid, [href*=. Example: golem::invoke_js("showhref", "thinkr.fr"). hidehref hideid, [href*=. Example: golem::invoke_js("hidehref", "thinkr.fr"). clickon Click element. full jQuery selector used. Example: golem::invoke_js("clickon", "#id"). disable Add "disabled" element. full jQuery selector used. Example: golem::invoke_js("disable", ".someClass"). reable Remove "disabled" element. full jQuery selector used. Example: golem::invoke_js("reable", ".someClass"). alert Open alert box message(s) provided. Example: golem::invoke_js("alert", "WELCOME APP");. prompt Open prompt box message(s) provided. function takes list message id list(message = "", id = ""). output prompt sent input$id. Example:  golem::invoke_js("prompt", list(message ="name?", id  = "name") ). confirm Open confirm box message provided. function takes list message id list(message = "", id = ""). output prompt sent input$id. Example:  golem::invoke_js("confirm", list(message ="sure want ?", id  = "name") ).

title: Interact with JavaScript built-in Functions — activate_js
text: Used side-effects.

title: Interact with JavaScript built-in Functions — activate_js
text: JavaScript functions can called server invoke_js. invoke_js can also used launch JS function created inside Shiny JavaScript handler.

title: Interact with JavaScript built-in Functions — activate_js
code: if (interactive()) {   library(shiny)   ui <- fluidPage(     golem::activate_js(), # already loaded in your golem by `bundle_resources()`     fluidRow(       actionButton(inputId = "hidebutton1", label = "hide button1"),       actionButton(inputId = "showbutton1", label = "show button1"),       actionButton(inputId = "button1", label = "button1")     ),     fluidRow(       actionButton(inputId = "hideclassA", label = "hide class A"),       actionButton(inputId = "showclassA", label = "show class A"),       actionButton(inputId = "buttonA1", label = "button A1", class = "A"),       actionButton(inputId = "buttonA2", label = "button A2", class = "A"),       actionButton(inputId = "buttonA3", label = "button A3", class = "A")     ),     fluidRow(       actionButton(inputId = "clickhide", label = "click on 'hide button1' and 'hide class A'"),       actionButton(inputId = "clickshow", label = "click on 'show button1' and 'show class A'")     ),     fluidRow(       actionButton(inputId = "disableA", label = "disable class A"),       actionButton(inputId = "reableA", label = "reable class A")     ),     fluidRow(       actionButton(inputId = "alertbutton", label = "alert button"),       actionButton(inputId = "promptbutton", label = "prompt button"),       actionButton(inputId = "confirmbutton", label = "confirm button")     )   )    server <- function(input, output, session) {     observeEvent(input$hidebutton1, {       golem::invoke_js("hideid", "button1")     })      observeEvent(input$showbutton1, {       golem::invoke_js("showid", "button1")     })      observeEvent(input$hideclassA, {       golem::invoke_js("hideclass", "A")     })     observeEvent(input$showclassA, {       golem::invoke_js("showclass", "A")     })      observeEvent(input$clickhide, {       golem::invoke_js("clickon", "#hidebutton1")       golem::invoke_js("clickon", "#hideclassA")     })      observeEvent(input$clickshow, {       golem::invoke_js("clickon", "#showbutton1")       golem::invoke_js("clickon", "#showclassA")     })      observeEvent(input$disableA, {       golem::invoke_js("disable", ".A")     })     observeEvent(input$reableA, {       golem::invoke_js("reable", ".A")     })      observeEvent(input$alertbutton, {       golem::invoke_js("alert", "ALERT!!")     })      observeEvent(input$promptbutton, {       golem::invoke_js("prompt", list(message = "what's your name?", id = "name"))     })     observeEvent(input$name, {       message(paste("input$name", input$name))     })      observeEvent(input$confirmbutton, {       golem::invoke_js("confirm", list(message = "Are you sure?", id = "sure"))     })     observeEvent(input$sure, {       message(paste("input$sure", input$sure))     })   }   shinyApp(ui, server) }

title: Add recommended elements — use_recommended_deps
text: use_recommended_deps Adds shiny, DT, attempt, glue, golem, htmltools dependencies use_recommended_tests Adds test folder copy golem tests

title: Add recommended elements — use_recommended_deps
code: use_recommended_deps(   pkg = get_golem_wd(),   recommended = c("shiny", "DT", "attempt", "glue", "htmltools", "golem") )  use_recommended_tests(   pkg = get_golem_wd(),   spellcheck = TRUE,   vignettes = TRUE,   lang = "en-US",   error = FALSE )

title: Add recommended elements — use_recommended_deps
text: pkg Path root package. Default get_golem_wd(). recommended vector recommended packages. spellcheck Whether use spellcheck test. vignettes Logical, TRUE spell check rmd rnw files vignettes/ folder. lang Preferred spelling language. Usually either "en-US" "en-GB". error Logical, indicating whether unit test fail spelling errors found. Defaults FALSE, error, prints potential spelling errors
